title: Statement by the Press Secretary on Dover Mortuary | whitehouse.gov
content:
The White House
Office of the Press Secretary


For Immediate Release
February 28, 2012

 



Statement by the Press Secretary on Dover Mortuary





	We are deeply concerned about reports that in 2001, some unidentified portions of remains from the 9/11 attacks were disposed of in a landfill, and about the unacceptable handling of remains at Dover. The President has been briefed on the independent review of Dover Port Mortuary and strongly supports the Pentagonâ€™s efforts to make needed systemic structural changes so that these types of incidents never happen again. The United States has a solemn obligation to compassionately and professionally care for fallen service members and their families, and those we tragically lost on 9/11.
